I'm an R Markdown document! 

```{r setup, message=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
```

# Section 1

Here's a **code chunk** that samples from 
a _normal distribution_:

```{r}
set.seed(1234)
samp = rnorm(100)
length(samp)
```

# Section 2

I can take the mean of the sample, too!
The mean is `r mean(samp)`.

```{r}
mean(samp)
sd(samp)
```

Let's make a data frame
```{r}
sample_df =
  tibble(
    vec.numeric=1:4,
    vec.char=c("my", "name", "is", "Jeff"),
    vec.factor=factor(c("male","male", "female", "female"))
  )
```

# section 4
```{r, echo=FALSE}
new_df = 
  tibble(
    x=rnorm(500, mean=1),
    y=(x>0),
    z=abs(x)
  )

ggplot(new_df, aes(x=z)) + geom_histogram() 
median_samp <- round(median(new_df$z),2)
```

the sample median is `r round(median(new_df$z),2)`.
